intro: Galium numidicum, commonly known as the Algerian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North Africa and parts of southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Galium numidicum is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
